meanings.definition: The emergence of an adult insect from its pupal case.
meanings.sent1: The eclosion of the butterfly was a beautiful sight in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the process of eclosion to understand insect development.
meanings.sent3: The eclosion of the moth was like a magical transformation in nature.
meanings.sent4: The eclosion of the insect symbolized a new beginning in the cycle of life.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the eclosion of the dragonfly left a lasting impression on the observer.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking free from a chrysalis or cocoon.
meanings.sent1: After the eclosion, the butterfly spread its wings for the first time.
meanings.sent2: The eclosion of the caterpillar amazed the children in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The eclosion of the beetle from its cocoon was like a tiny celebration.
meanings.sent4: The eclosion of the insect was a symbol of freedom and transformation.
meanings.sent5: The eclosion of the moth from its chrysalis was a moment of pure wonder.

meanings.definition: The process of a butterfly or moth emerging from its pupal stage.
meanings.sent1: The eclosion of the butterfly marked the end of its pupal stage.
meanings.sent2: Students learned about the eclosion of butterflies in their science class.
meanings.sent3: The eclosion of the moth was like a graceful dance of nature.
meanings.sent4: The eclosion of the butterfly was a delicate and intricate process.
meanings.sent5: The eclosion of the moth symbolized the completion of its transformation.
